Encourage her to stay connected with neighbors or community groups to combat isolation. Always prioritize her safety and well-being, and document your efforts for guardianship records.

Set clear boundaries by delegating tasks—perhaps involve other family members or hire occasional help—and prioritize self-care to avoid burnout, like scheduling time for your own family. If her challenges worsen, consult her doctor or a geriatric care manager for tailored advice.
